intro: Drimia khubusensis, commonly known as the Khubus bulbous plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its underground bulbous structure. The plant produces clusters of white or pale blue flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
